intro: Echinocactus phyllacanthoides, commonly known as the Mexican star cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its thick, spiny stems that are often ribbed and covered in a layer of white, waxy material. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the summer months, which emerge from the areoles along the stems. It is a slow-growing cactus that thrives in full sun and well-draining soil. Due to its unique appearance and hardiness, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
